channel.title: Can you transfer videos to
channel.description:
Your Sony Ericsson W108i?
I was just wondering.
Just as we are talking about Sony Ericsson, Can you makes .MP3 files your ringtone in anyway?

item.title: Can you transfer videos to
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

nope its just if you edit your card and put it in the wrong folder on your card then it will fuck up but if you put it in the same one as the rest of your music then you will be safe

Read full topic

item.title: Can you transfer videos to
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Gotta Catch Them All, post:11, topic:97289”][quote author=Uriko link=topic=140008.msg1349583#msg1349583 date=1179695768]

nope its umm hold on ill plug my phone in[br][size=1]Posted on: May 20, 2007, 08:59:18 AM[/size][hr].3gp files there a pain in the ass to convert but you can

I found a couple of converters but there all free trials and only convert the first 90 secounds (GAY)
[/quote]www.warez-bb.org Find it there

Ok, when you connect your Ericsson go into it’s drive, browse through, you’ll find a folder called ringtunes at some point (I don’t know its exact location because my Ericsson isn’t working atm), put your mp3’s there, disconnect, wait for it to reboot your phone, then go into the ringtunes folder on your phone, right click the song and set it to the ringtune.

The song or file doesn’t have to be in a certain folder to be your ringtone btw.[/quote]
I just wanna make sure, because my friend did the same thing but didn’t put it in his ringtone folder and he wasn’t able to add it as a ringtone for some reason :S.

Read full topic

item.title: Can you transfer videos to
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:8, topic:97289”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=140008.msg1349549#msg1349549 date=1179695373]

nope its umm hold on ill plug my phone in[br][size=1]Posted on: May 20, 2007, 08:59:18 AM[/size][hr].3gp files there a pain in the ass to convert but you can

I found a couple of converters but there all free trials and only convert the first 90 secounds (GAY)
[/quote]www.warez-bb.org Find it there

Ok, when you connect your Ericsson go into it’s drive, browse through, you’ll find a folder called ringtunes at some point (I don’t know its exact location because my Ericsson isn’t working atm), put your mp3’s there, disconnect, wait for it to reboot your phone, then go into the ringtunes folder on your phone, right click the song and set it to the ringtune.[/quote]

The song or file doesn’t have to be in a certain folder to be your ringtone btw.[br][size=1]Posted on: May 21, 2007, 04:52:51 PM[/size][hr][quote=“deoxys505, post:10, topic:97289”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=140008.msg1345403#msg1345403 date=1179641168]
Your Sony Ericsson W108i?

I was just wondering.

Just as we are talking about Sony Ericsson, Can you makes .MP3 files your ringtone in anyway?
[/quote]If either of these are your phone, then i know what im talking about:

Error, you said it is the W108i not the correct name–W810i

Now to your question.

yes you can put vidoes on it, take your memory card out and put it in your computer if you can. If not just connect the phone using the usb cord. after that, open my computer and go to “PHONE CARD” or the name of your memory card. then go to the folder that is named MMSC or something like that [im at school and the gay comps dont have card slots and my usb cable is at home, so i dont remember the exact folder name (will edit later and post screenies)]
and go to media files and then go to videos and then put your video in that folder (make sure it obviously fits on your card). then go back and go to the music or sounds or ringtones folder, and put your mp3’s in it. after that, everything should work.

P.S. if your mp3’s are too big, it won’t let you make it a ringtone, so if it doesn’t work, you are gonna need to make it smaller by using a program or something.[/quote]

What? I can have any size ringtone on my phone.

Read full topic

item.title: Can you transfer videos to
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:1, topic:97289”]Your Sony Ericsson W108i?

I was just wondering.

Just as we are talking about Sony Ericsson, Can you makes .MP3 files your ringtone in anyway?[/quote]If either of these are your phone, then i know what im talking about:

Error, you said it is the W108i not the correct name–W810i

Now to your question.

yes you can put vidoes on it, take your memory card out and put it in your computer if you can. If not just connect the phone using the usb cord. after that, open my computer and go to “PHONE CARD” or the name of your memory card. then go to the folder that is named MMSC or something like that [im at school and the gay comps dont have card slots and my usb cable is at home, so i dont remember the exact folder name (will edit later and post screenies)]
and go to media files and then go to videos and then put your video in that folder (make sure it obviously fits on your card). then go back and go to the music or sounds or ringtones folder, and put your mp3’s in it. after that, everything should work.

P.S. if your mp3’s are too big, it won’t let you make it a ringtone, so if it doesn’t work, you are gonna need to make it smaller by using a program or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Can you transfer videos to
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

N00b1:

if its one of the Walkmans you get a 500mb card with an internal as well usb to plug into your pc but if you record with it and want the video on your pc you need to convert it (pain in the ass)

Umm it is a Walkman but came with a fucking 128mb…
And what file type does it have to be to put it in, MP4?

Uriko:

Yes, do you have a connection cord for your Sony Ericsson?

Mhmm…

Read full topic

item.description:

My phone has a small ass 32mb memory card, have you tried searching yours for one? (I put my card in my camera, connect camera to pc, put stuff on camera + put card back in phone)
